parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and violent shaking of the front end of the vehicle, also known as the "Ford Death Wobble," can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: often after hitting a bump or pothole
making it difficult to maintain control; the steering wheel vibrates or shakes; the vehicle pulls to one side; and the brakes may be affected.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake failure can cause accidents, injuries, and fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal goes to the floor; the brake pedal has to be pumped several times; the vehicle stalls without warning; and the brake calipers overheat.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Power steering failure can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The steering becomes difficult or impossible; the steering wheel vibrates or shakes; and the vehicle pulls to one side.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front suspension/steering system can cause the vehicle to shake violently, making it difficult to control, which can lead to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The front end of the vehicle shakes violently
the vehicle becomes difficult to control
the vehicle travels uncontrollably across multiple lanes
the failure occurs when hitting a bump or imperfection in the road.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the oil cooler can cause the engine to overheat, leading to stalling, loss of power, and potentially catastrophic engine damage.
symptoms: White smoke coming out of the exhaust

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the FICM can cause the engine to stall, lose power, and potentially lead to accidents.
The failure of the high-pressure oil pump can cause the engine to lose power, stall, and potentially lead to catastrophic engine damage.
The failure of the EGR valve can cause the engine to overheat, lose power, and potentially lead to catastrophic engine damage.
symptoms: white smoke coming out of the exhaust

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Stalling and Loss of Power
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine stalling and loss of power can cause accidents, especially when driving at high speeds.
The failure of the 6.0L Powerstroke engine can cause the vehicle to stall, lose power, and experience sudden deceleration, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle stalls or shuts down while driving
has a whiny or unusual turbo sound
has a sudden loss of pressure
and may have warning lights illuminated on the instrument panel.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the EGR cooler can cause the vehicle to overheat, experience sudden loss of power, and stall, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: has white smoke coming from the exhaust
and may have warning lights illuminated on the instrument panel.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the FICM can cause the vehicle to stall, lose power, and experience sudden deceleration, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle stalls or shuts down while driving
and may have warning lights illuminated on the instrument panel.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch and transmission can cause the vehicle to stall, lose power, and experience sudden deceleration, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle stalls or shuts down while driving
and may have warning lights illuminated on the instrument panel.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rusting of the frame and header leaks can cause the vehicle to experience structural damage, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: and the headers are leaking due to rust.
